meanings.definition: A book containing rules and guidelines for writing and formatting documents.
meanings.sent1: I always keep my stylebook handy when I write essays for school.
meanings.sent2: The journalist consulted the stylebook to ensure proper formatting of the article.
meanings.sent3: The stylebook whispered to the notebook, 'Let's make sure these paragraphs are perfectly aligned.'
meanings.sent4: Her mind became a stylebook, organizing thoughts neatly into chapters and sections.
meanings.sent5: The stylebook stood out on the shelf, its cover adorned with writing tips and tricks.

meanings.definition: A set of standards for the design and appearance of a publication.
meanings.sent1: The magazine publisher followed the stylebook to create a visually appealing layout.
meanings.sent2: Graphic designers refer to the stylebook to maintain consistency in their projects.
meanings.sent3: The stylebook and the magazine cover had a friendly competition on who looked more stylish.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed within the boundaries of the stylebook, like a garden in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The stylebook acted as a fashion designer, dressing up each page with elegance and flair.

meanings.definition: A reference guide for writers and editors on language usage and grammar.
meanings.sent1: Writers treasure their stylebook for quick answers on grammar questions.
meanings.sent2: Editors rely on the stylebook to maintain consistency in language throughout the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The stylebook chuckled as it corrected a misplaced comma in the writer's draft.
meanings.sent4: Words danced gracefully on the page, following the rhythm set by the stylebook.
meanings.sent5: The stylebook became a trusted companion, guiding writers through the maze of language rules.
